column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/bucs-make-moves-at-tackle/|Bucs Make Moves At Tackle|The Bucs lost a guy Joe hoped they would keep. A couple of hours later
column2: the Bucs apparently found his replacement. Now Joe knows that the mere mention of backup tackle Justin Skule gives many Bucs an immediate case of the shivers. But Joe has to be fair. After starting for concussed Luke Goedeke at right tackle in Week 2 at Detroit
column3: Skule got fully worked over by Aidan Hutchison. It was gruesome
column4: maybe the worst Joe has seen since Kenyatta Walker tried to tangle with Julius Peppers. Once that horrid game was over
column5: Skule did a nice job subbing for Goedeke. Just before the bye
column6: Tristan Wirfs got hurt against the 49ers and Skule had to replace him. Joe thought Nick Bosa was going to run wild on Skule. Oh
column7: Bosa made a play or two
column8: but Skule did a solid job on one of the best pass rushers in the game. So Skule developed into quite a solid backup tackle. Joe was hoping the Bucs would keep him. Instead
column9: Skule hustled off to Minneapolis. A couple of hours after the news of Skule was announced
column10: the Bucs signed free agent veteran tackle Charlie Heck. Last year playing for both Arizona and San Francisco
column12: both for the 49ers. He’s 28 years old and stands 6-8
column13: 320 pounds. Houston drafted Heck in 2020 out of North Carolina in the fourth round. In 2021
column14: Heck started 13 games at right tackle for the Texans. In the past three seasons
column15: Heck has six starts.|2025-03-13 22:18:00|256|35|4|Bucs|Bucs find replacement for departing tackle|3|Comments are mixed

column2: the Bucs’ stud receiver avoided all specifics when talking about his potential return to health. Buccaneers Ring of Honor general manager Jason Licht shared the news conference but nobody in the media throng attending asked him when he expects Godwin on the field. However
column3: Godwin hopped on SiriusXM NFL Radio and co-host Pat Kirwan talked to Godwin about seeing him on the field in-person this summer in training camp. Godwin responded with a huge smile in his voice as well as a chuckle. He acknowledged that he’ll be happy to be back on the field. “You’ll see me drenched in sweat
column5: ” Godwin said. What Godwin said after that came out garbled garbled

column3: per NFL Network. Vildor started all three Lions playoff games two seasons ago and last year played all 17 games on a Lions secondary ravaged by injuries. Maybe a few like Giants Browns or Bengals if they miss playoffs again. That would be only one ai could see him bolting for out of those 3. Dolphins could open up which could also be a possible landing spot for him since he already has worked there. Outside of those 2 don\u2019t see him bolting.""
column65: ""post"": ""Hey Joe! Don\u2019t forget about rookie Devin Culp.""
column74: ""post"": ""Great points Defense Rules. Love reading your posts by the way. They have to force more turnovers and stop doing it themselves. Minus 4 is awful. Has to be corrected this season if they want to make a deep run in the playoffs.""
column83: ""post"": ""If Grizzard does good he\u2019ll stay at least 1 more year. He won\u2019t be in that much of a hurry to be another Baker victim and be forced to take a $13 million job as a head coach. He\u2019ll take another year to hone and improve his newly needed skills. You never know
column84: if he is really exceptional in his first year and Coach Bowles retires\u2026 I just hope the offense stays hot and can be in the red zone within 5 or 6 plays like last year. So fun to watch!!!""
column93: ""post"": ""There is one obstacle. The trajectory of declining performance by the defense since BA handed over the reins. Baker might only get the ball for three possessions at this rate.""

That\u2019s Crazy!The Offense spent too much time sitting on their butts!""

column177: ""post"": ""The biggest key for me will be TRUST! We need Bowles to trust Grizzard and his now veteran laden offense to execute and carry the team when needed. ""
column186: ""post"": ""Why don\u2019t the bucs lock in the OC for more than 1 year with the option of releasing him at their option & with a 2nd option of extending for another 2 years this way they have the advantage this will stop the abuse of power by the employees or r they stupid ?""
column195: ""post"": ""It\u2019s like when team goes after a QB & the QB has all the advantages so u end up with a cousins or Watson dilemma.never understood the mentality it\u2019s always to the employee benefit not the employer that theory does not work in the real world""
